Posts.Content: Thanks for  that Dreamthief .   I think the reality is dawning on Hubby now . But as long as I can carry on as normal thats  all  that matters and I can cope .
Posts.Title: Is this it for now .

Posts.Content: Hi    I had my first session of Fec last thurs  and after a normal friday   I had a few side effects   Diahorrea     nauseua  tiredness  for 3 days .   Since yesterday however  I seem to be back to normal self and I cant quite beleive how quickly this has happened .     Of course im worried that it will all return with a vengence But is this the normal course of things or will it return and continue until my next session on 26 Apr .    I know everybody is differentn but any advice is helpful .    Thank you all and Huge hugs to anybody having a tough time . x x x
Posts.Title: Is this it for now .

Posts.Content: Hi dotty 25   .   As  many have said the waiting is definitely the worse part of all this .    I was due to start my 1st Chemo session on Feb 16th but because of small part of my Masectomy wound not healing it was cancelled 4 times  .   But thats another story and Im starting my Chemo on April 5th so thats good . . .sort of !        Keep pushing for definite answers and timelines  .  Dont be brushed off  .    I know that Doctors are busy and have a lot of  patients to see to  but you have only   1 body and   your priority is looking after it .   Try to keep busy and enjoy your beautiful new baby  and stay in touch with this site .   There is always somebody here who will chat to you   any time of the day or night  .  Good luck with your results . Take care  .       Imelda x x x
Posts.Title: A total mess

Posts.Content: A huge Thank You to all the lovely replies that I got to yesterdays post .        Your kind words and lovely comments have helped me so so much and have made me realise that things will hopefully get better and that the route which I am now taking will bring me the help which I need .     You are such a lovely bunch of people and I have no doubts that I will be posting here very soon about how awful Chemo is   !    But for now I just want to grab it and run as fast as I can and outrun it .     Thanks again  .  Concepta x x x
Posts.Title: Thanking everybody

Posts.Content: Good morning everybody . Concepta here  . In approx 5 hours I will be starting my first of 6 chemo sessions .    Its been a long time coming and  Im  more than ready for it . . .I think .     But I have 1 concern  . Its my Husband .      He seems to have some sort of mental block about this whole cancer thing .      Hes a very private person , doesnt have any friends and seems to be going more and more into himself especially since my diagnoses . His mobility is very poor due to a terrible accident  19 years ago but he could do a lot more for himself than he does but that is largely my fault  . Perhaps I have looked after him too well since his accident  .              He doesnt seem to be able to engage in conversation at all regarding  my illness    .  When I try to discuss it with him I just get replys of yes or  no   .  I have told him umpteen times all about chemo and what it entails  , the side effects dangers etc but he doesnt seem to be taking it in at all  . I have shown him my Sepsis Red card and have told him that he must get me to the hospital ASAP if I become ill .   The final straw came yesterday when he told me that perhaps we could wash our motorhome at the weekend as the weather is due to be good .  I could not beleive what I was hearing and when i explained that it wasnt going to happen he couldnt understand why  .   .  He is good and kind and generous in every way and we will be married 50 years in December   but im finding his attitude at the moment hard to cope with ..   I have  2 wonderful daughters who have given me such support that I will never be able to thank them enough . And a son who rings me to ask if Im ok .    Im just wondering if anybody else has had this happen to them .          Concepta .
Posts.Title: Mental block .

Posts.Content: Good luck Aprillee   fingers crossed for you tomorrow  Do you know what your first treatment is called    just take 1 day at a time and look after yourself  .Im having my 4th out 6 tomorrow  so im getting there .  .take care   Imelda
Posts.Title: FIRST CHEMO

Posts.Content: Jenny   Im only up the road if you need anything ever .. Im away tomorrow until Sat  but next week im free  all week until the dreaded Number  3 on Thursday  . Hope youre ok and not suffering in this heat . Take care     Imelda   AKA Concepta    x x x
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Where is this walk Jenny. Where would I start ?  Hope you're well .  I had my final FEC on Thursday .  So  next is my 3 Taxotere .   Then done tG ...looking forward so much to the Birmingham meet up ..and looking forward to meeting you  .      Until then take care x x x .Imelda
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: LeoLady   do you find the Tai Chi classes helpful       . Imelda
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Oh lovely LeoLady   so sorry that you had to take a trip in the Ambulance  and a short stay with our wonderful NHS .  But glad that youre back at home now for the night .   Those ruber beds are sooooo uncomfortable .    Take care of yourself . Sending huge hugsx x x  Imelda
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Thank  s seaspirit 44   I may well do this .  But I worry about a handbell getting lost or mislaid  so still want a nice brass Bell on the wall . Im a very determined woman so Mr CEO beware !
Posts.Title: A Bell To Ring

Posts.Content: Good evening ladies    I havnt been on here for a while so I hope you havnt forgotten me .    Im having Chemo no 4   (  2 more to go after this one ) on friday  and its going to be a different drug for the next 3 . Done the Fecs  ,now got to do the T trucks .... Last Chemo is on the 20 July and i cant wait to ring the Bell .   The only problem is that there is no bell at the Chemo suite that i go to . I have sent a polite email to the Chief Executive at the hospital but as yet have not received even an aknowledgement over 2 weeks later .    I have even offered to pay for the bell myself and i have a very nice handyman who has offered to hang it on the wall for us .. But still nothing ..   But Im not one for giving up and I will pursue this until i get the Bell .   Of course I want it for myself   but I also want it for all the people that will come after me and will want to ring it .    Ive always beleived that a positive attitude is very important in dealing with this horrible illness  and there is nothing more negative than a No reply .  So well done Mr CEO ..  Thats it rant over for tonight but i will keep you all updated on my  quest .   nighty night   Imelda  (AKA  Concepta )
Posts.Title: A Bell To Ring

Posts.Content: Hi Sortitout   Good luck for tomorrow . Hope everything turns out good for you      Imelda x
Posts.Title: Results day tomorrow - both hopeful and terrifirf

Posts.Content: Thank you . This helps a lot . I just needed to know roughly how it works .   Thanks again . Hope youre doing ok  .
Posts.Title: Working out when my Chemo will be

Posts.Content: Im having my first Chemo session on Feb 27 followed by 5 subsequent sessions every 3  weeks .  I realise there may be delays and hold ups  but all being well how do i work out the 3 week  thing  .?
Posts.Title: Working out when my Chemo will be

Posts.Content: Hi    I had my first Fec 2 weeks ago and it was 3 days before the side effects hit me    and even then Hit is not really the word I would use  .   A feeling of nausea wafted around me for a couple of days ad then   . . .gone .   Fit as a fiddle now and experiencing an energy surge which you can read about on a different thread    .    You will be fine dont worry . this is a brilliant site  .Lovely people and fantastic advice and tips   .  Stay happy .
Posts.Title: FEC first one done

Posts.Content: Thanks weeblemum     Loads to look forward to then  .  ah well lets get this party started  . Love and hugs to all  x x x Imelda
Posts.Title: Finished Fec .

Posts.Content: Hi everybody   Concepta (  Imelda  ) here   I posted a question a couple of days ago .  Dont know if anybody saw it or even i didnt post properly   . But anyway here goes again     Ive just finished my 3 Fecs  . . .done and dusted     Next is 3 Taxotere and im wondering what box of delights they hold in store for me  !    I have been told by my oncology nurse that the Taxotere is not so bad for the nausea but causes aches and pains and sensitive skin  .     But like everything else in life if you want to know something ask the experts  . thats why im asking all you ladies especially those of you who have done the same regime  .. Await with eagerness all your replies .   Take care everybody and be happy x x xImelda
Posts.Title: Finished Fec .

Posts.Content: Just got back from my Oncologist and  yes yes yes . . .my wound has finally healed and my 1st Chemo session is on April 3rd  .       Cant beleive we got there in the end    .    Dont know if anybody has wished for Chemo as much as me .     Thank you everybody for all the lovely messages of support on this site  ...    Talk again soon x x x
Posts.Title: Finally ready !

Posts.Content: Sally  I had a seroma back in March . It wasnt painful at all but it wouldnt heal for ages .. Every time I went to the Breast Clinic all they did was say  " it will heal .you just have to be patient "  This really annoyed me as i kept having my Chemo cancelled because if it .  My first session should have been Feb 16 but because of my wound not healing i didnt start until April 16 .which was quite a wait  .   When did you have your op as in the beginning seromas do take a while to stop draining  .    But if your wound s not healing you need  to ask questions   >Why  /    How long are you going to give it ?  If it hasnt healed by such and such what will you do then ?    I didnt ask as  beleived they knew best . But my daughter stepped in and got PALS involved and boy did that work !  Ask for Silver Nitrate  to assist wound healing . I hope you get sorted  Sally .  Take care and try not to worry   Imeldax x x
Posts.Title: Seroma/ pain

Posts.Content: Sally  I had a seroma back in March . It wasnt painful at all but it wouldnt heal for ages .. Every time I went to the Breast Clinic all they did was say  " it will heal .you just have to be patient "  This really annoyed me as i kept having my Chemo cancelled because if it .  My first session should have been Feb 16 but because of my wound not healing i didnt start until April 16 .which was quite a wait  .   When did you have your op as in the beginning seromas do take a while to stop draining  .    But if your wound s not healing you need  to ask questions   >Why  /    How long are you going to give it ?  If it hasnt healed by such and such what will you do then ?    I didnt ask as  beleived they knew best . But my daughter stepped in and got PALS involved and boy did that work !  Ask for Silver Nitrate  to assist wound healing . I hope you get sorted  Sally .  Take care and try not to worry   Imeldax x x
Posts.Title: Seroma/ pain

Posts.Content: Did the Dr say maybe what was causing the awful pain  .If its wound healing pain  ( and i know im not a doctor ) all i can say that it should subside as time goes   by   and the wound heals    .  good luck with the oncologist tomorrow Let me know what happens
Posts.Title: Seroma/ pain

Posts.Content: Sally  thats exactly how I felt and I was blaming myself for not taking action sooner ,  not eating the proper foods to promote wound healing etc  blaming myself basi . cally for everything but the lovely ladies on here pit me right .   I dont know if you read my previous reply  but you now need to start giving them timelines   .   ie   " if its not healed in 1/2 weeks whats the next step  and so on  Have they mentioned Silver Nitrate to you ?   It kind of seals the wound by Cautherising it and it can help .      Hope this helps as I know exactly how you are feeling  .   Keep in touch and I will help in any way I can  .    Love and hugs  x x xConcepta (AKA   Imelda )
Posts.Title: Seroma/ pain

Posts.Content: Did the Dr say maybe what was causing the awful pain  .If its wound healing pain  ( and i know im not a doctor ) all i can say that it should subside as time goes   by   and the wound heals    .  good luck with the oncologist tomorrow Let me know what happens

Posts.Title: Seroma/ pain

Posts.Content: Hi Leolady    , I know you have been there for me with advice  about my  Wound not healing  so its kind of    " Nice " to know that were both starting our Chemo in April . . .April Fools R Us  !   . Im starting the first of 3 Fec   ( whatever  that means ) on Thurs  5th April and you hopefully  will be following on 19th   . Good luck to you and talk along the way .  Hope your roads not too bumpy .   Hugs and love      Imelda x
Posts.Title: *** April 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: Hi Cgs54     I hope youre doing ok after your 2nd session .  It is a bit daunting when they hand you something to read and sign  but do we really have a choice  . I wouldnt say no to anything that is going to do me good . . .in the long run .          I had my first Fec on thurs and so far so good   .thank God ..  Feel a little bit queasy first thing in the morning .. . bit like morning sickness actually !          But after about  1 hour it just goes  .         My daughter keeps telling me to stop saying      " nothing yet "  when people ask me how I am  . She says it sounds like Im expecting it to happen  ( which I am ) .  So thats how I am now on day 3 .     Anybody out there a late starter or is this the way it is ?         Concepta x x x
Posts.Title: *** April 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: Hi Sammystaff    My hair has started to fall out today . Its sad but just an indication that the Chemo is doing the job correctly  .    Were off to Wales on friday for a few days before my second round of Fec  next Thurs.  So I suppose by the time i get back it will be gone  for a while ....   "  I left my heart in San Francisco "  .   Well beat this    I left my hair in north Wales   !    sing the song ladies  .       Hugs to everybody finding  it tough at the moment x x x
Posts.Title: *** April 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: liziX Where you are now is where I was last week . . .waiting to start and fear of the unknown .    Everybody is different and of course youre scared .   The best advice I can offer you is to take it as it comes . Nobody knows in advance how its going to effect them and its very much a case of wait and see .. As somebody has said  be kind to yourself and organise somebody to lend a hand .. This is when the cream rises to the surface where friends are concerned and Im sure you have lots of good ones .    Rest when you need toand sleep is lovely !     As far as the school run is concerned I cant advise . . . Im 71 and never did a school run in my life as walking to school was the norm then .  Look after yoursely and love and hugs and good luck x x x
Posts.Title: *** April 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: Oh that's great news liziX  about your own room even if you are going home soon  . At least its goodbye to the dreaded commode being wheeled in and out   Hats off to that Brilliant nurse who got  ypu your own room    . Take care   and lots of hugs to your little ones    Imelda
Posts.Title: *** April 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: No itchy Bum for me but  Roseca . . .lovely rosey cheeks we used to call them for me today . . .Nice to looked healthy for a change !
Posts.Title: *** April 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: Hi  Ive take Omeprazole daily for years  anyway because i suffer from Acid Reflux due to a Hiatius Hernia ,   So my BCN advised me to up my dose from 15mg to 30 mg and its worked for me .  So maybe this helps .   Good luck for Wed x x x
Posts.Title: *** April 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: Good luck  lizix    .  You will be grand .  hugs and thinking about you x x x
Posts.Title: *** April 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: liziX. I'm . So so sorry for your predicament. . I work in a hospital on an acute medical ward and my best  advice to you is Complain complain complain .   I know all about staff shortages etc etc  but none of this is your fault .  You should not be in a ward where people have got diahorrea for heaven's sake . At the very least you should be in a side too  . Threaten to go home unless you are moved even if they have to put you in a broom cupboard . . .make sure they take the groom's out first though     Good luck and loads of hugs X X X .       Imelda K
Posts.Title: *** April 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Club ***
